snippet: Evaluations that Boeing conducted while the the 787 jet was in development proved to be far off the mark in predicting what would happen when the plane was in use.
abstract: Evaluations that Boeing conducted while its new 787 jet was in development proved to be far off the mark in predicting what would happen when the plane was in use, and led company to severely underestimate likelihood of a fire in plane's battery; federal officials say it is crucial that Boeing collect better data this time on newly approved laboratory and flight tests.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER DREW and JAD MOUAWAD

lead_paragraph: Evaluations that Boeing conducted while the the 787 jet was in development proved to be far off the mark in predicting what would happen when the plane was in use.

headline.main: Initial Tests of Battery by Boeing Fell Short
headline.print_headline: Initial Tests Of Battery By Boeing Fell Short
